newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR SLIPS FURTHER ON IMPORT PRESSURE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR SLIPS FURTHER ON IMPORT PRESSURE.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar was quoted stable on the rand but weakened against other hard currencies as import pressure stepped up on Wednesday morning, dealers said.

"The market is kind of quiet at the moment but it has already lost a cent from where we opened on the back of importer demand. I believe there should be more activity later on because it looks like there's more importer demand than there are export receipts," a dealer commented.

At around 0800 GMT, the local unit was trading at 10.6850/7050 against the U.S. dollar, down from 10.6750/6950 overnight and also lost a few cents to 17.9240/9680 from 17.8700/9140 against pound sterling.
It was quoted at 7.1080/1230 versus the mark compared with Tuesday's 7.1000/1150 close, but held steady against the rand at 2.2990/3070. --Stella Mapenzauswa, Harare Newsroom: +263-4 72 52 28/9--
